page.title: 13LIVINGSTON DILEMMA
page.content: In February 1985 Livingston Development Corp. finally decided to refuse{Union Carbide's}plans to erect a gas processing plant in Deans,Livingston.A recent disaster had involved Union Carbide's plant in {Bhopal,India,}when{2500 people}died after a gas leak at their plant there. L.D.C.'s decision followed much debate in the area. On the one hand it would provide needed employment and the Company held public meetings to convince the locals that public safety would be their most important priority but the public protested very forcefully at these meetings. They preferred safety in the environment for themselves and their children. L.D.C. paid heed to{public reaction. Whether the Livingston public were right or wrong,only future generations will be able to judge!
